import vectordraw
### Custom Checks ###
def check_y_intercept(check, vectors): vec = vectors[check['vector']] tolerance = check.get('tolerance', 1.0) expected = check['expected'] slope = (vec.tip.y-vec.tail.y)/(vec.tip.x-vec.tail.x) y_intercept = vec.tail.y - slope*vec.tail.x dist = abs(expected - y_intercept) if dist > tolerance: return "Hmm, is your tangent line touching the curve?"
custom_checks = { 'y_intercept': check_y_intercept, } success_message = 'Good job!'
grader = vectordraw.Grader(success_message, custom_checks)
problem.p: Using the slope and intercept that you found above, draw the line tangent to the curve in the first quadrant at \(x=1\). Does your answer make sense?

p.em: Stretch and orient your tangent line by dragging its ends; shift your tangent line by dragging the line's center. em
